verses.roman:
'lālyāmedhya' lālakera candana-sama bhāya
sanātanera klede āmāra ghṛṇā nā upajāya"

synonyms: lālya—of the maintained child; amedhya—stool and urine; lālakera—of the maintainer; candana-sama—like sandalwood pulp; bhāya—appears; sanātanera—of Sanātana Gosvāmī; klede—unto the moisture of the sores; āmāra—My; ghṛṇā—hatred; nā—not; upajāya—arises.
translation: "The stool and urine of the maintained child appear like sandalwood pulp to the mother. Similarly, when the foul moisture oozing from the itches of Sanātana touches My body, I have no hatred for him."
